thread.title: Alleged triggerman identified in killing of tourist, hiker
thread.title_full: Alleged triggerman identified in killing of tourist, hiker - US News

author: USNews
title: Alleged triggerman identified in killing of tourist, hiker
text:
Alleged shooter identified among 3 transient charged in California killing of tourist, hiker Multnomah County Sheriff's Office photos show the three suspects who were arrested Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Portland, Ore., in the killing of Steve Carter, a tantra yoga teacher, on a hiking trail in Marin County, Calif. From left are Sean Michael Angold, 24; Lila Scott Allgood, 19; and Morrison Haze Lampley, 23. A hiker found Carter's body on Monday. (Multnomah County Sheriff's Office/Portland police via AP)
Associated Press Oct. 13, 2015 | 7:30 p.m. EDT + More By PAUL ELIAS, Associated Press
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) â€” Prosecutors have identified the alleged triggerman among the three transients charged with the shooting death of a Canadian backpacker and yoga instructor in Northern California last week.
A criminal complaint filed Tuesday in Marin County Superior Court charges 23-year-old Morrison Haze Lampley with pulling the trigger of a stolen Smith & Wesson handgun while the trio robbed their alleged victims.
Lampley and his two traveling companions are all charged with murder with special circumstances, making them eligible for the death penalty. Lampley, 24-year-old Sean Michael Angold and 18-year-old Lila Scott Alligood are scheduled to make their first court appearances Wednesday.
The Marin County district attorney said a decision on whether to pursue the death penalty will be made later.
